content: Jesse Owens stood out among other athletes during that time because he broke several records and achieved four gold medals in a single Olympic event. This was particularly notable because Owens competed in the 1936 Berlin Olympics, which Adolf Hitler intended to use as a platform to showcase his belief in Aryan supremacy. Owens, an African American, challenged these beliefs by demonstrating his athletic superiority and breaking the records of the time, thus becoming an icon of civil rights and a symbol of the fight against racism.
